intro: Eriocaulon trisectum, commonly known as the three-lobed rice sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense clusters at the base of the stems. It typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. Eriocaulon trisectum is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
